briefing.opening: Good morning/afternoon. Welcome to the climate change expert spokesperson briefing on December 19, 2025.

sections.title: ğŸ”´ Worsening Climate Crisis Warnings and Global Impacts
sections.content: Today's climate-related news reports numerous warnings about the intensifying global climate crisis. Significant changes in polar ecosystems have been observed, with 70% of emperor penguin chicks disappearing in Antarctica and Arctic temperatures reaching their highest levels since 1900 [7, 8]. Domestically, despite the dissipation of El NiÃ±o's influence, abnormally high temperatures persist, with 'extreme heatwaves' forecast for next summer, leading to analyses that climate disasters are becoming normalized [13, 19]. Internationally, the UK's worst-case climate crisis scenario has been released [106], and research on the impact of global food systems on obesity and climate change has also been published [100, 112]. Furthermore, widespread damage across ecosystems is being reported, including new plant species in the Philippines being threatened by climate change [115] and Greek fir forests dying off [117], underscoring the urgent need for immediate action.

sections.title: ğŸŒ± Acceleration of Domestic Carbon Neutrality and Greenhouse Gas Reduction Efforts
sections.content: Domestic companies and local governments are accelerating concrete efforts to achieve carbon neutrality and reduce greenhouse gas emissions. HL Mando has officially received approval from SBTi (Science Based Targets initiative) for its goal to reduce greenhouse gases by up to 66% by 2035 [2, 9, 10, 11, 12, 15, 16, 20, 21, 22, 42, 52, 59, 61, 99], positioning itself at the forefront of global ESG management. In Jeju, the world's largest 'Ocean Lab' is planned to protect marine life suffering from climate change [1, 5], and Jeonnam Bioindustry Foundation and Farm In Tech Co., Ltd. have signed an investment agreement for developing microorganisms to combat climate change [3]. Haenam County is expanding low-carbon agriculture with 'eco-friendly produce that tackles the climate crisis' [14, 18, 36], while Yecheon County and Goheung County are encouraging community participation by being selected as excellent municipalities for carbon neutrality practices or by providing incentives [34, 38, 39, 45, 51, 56, 57, 58, 64]. Furthermore, the Korea Environmental Industry & Technology Institute (KEITI) is tripling new projects for carbon neutrality and climate crisis response [27], and Korea Electric Power Corporation (KEPCO) is taking the lead in responding to the climate crisis by taking responsibility from the power grid to carbon neutrality [40], demonstrating active movements from various stakeholders.

sections.title: ğŸŒ± Progress and Challenges in Renewable Energy Transition
sections.content: The transition to renewable energy is gaining global attention as a scientific innovation and is being actively discussed both domestically and internationally. The science journal 'Science' highlighted the importance of renewable energy by selecting it as this year's scientific innovation [68, 75, 91, 98]. Domestically, private-led renewable heat certification has taken its first step [24, 92], and the hydrogen fuel cell industry is exploring solutions for clean hydrogen transition, officially commencing discussions on achieving carbon neutrality [25, 33]. In Gochang County, discussions were held on a resident-participation model for agri-photovoltaic power generation [70, 72, 83, 84], and Gwangmyeong City's Citizen Power Cooperative demonstrated the potential of a citizen-participatory model by donating renewable energy profits to a 'Climate Response Fund' [74, 81, 86, 87]. However, challenges remain in the renewable energy transition process, including a dispute over the feasibility of achieving 10GW of renewable energy in Saemangeum [76], and the inclusion of air-source heat pumps as renewable energy facing backlash amid 'large corporate favoritism' controversy [85].

sections.title: ğŸŒ Global Corporate and Policy Trends and Climate Justice
sections.content: In international and domestic policy discussions, there is a growing emphasis on climate justice alongside various approaches to climate change response. Meanwhile, concerns have been raised that women are being excluded from climate crisis discussions [17], highlighting the need for inclusive climate policy formulation. WuXi Biologics Cayman achieved the highest 'A' rating in CDP's climate change and water security categories [114], demonstrating a best practice in ESG management for global corporations. India's dairy sector offers market opportunities to protect people and livelihoods through climate adaptation [111], and Ireland is pursuing its own strategy, aiming to establish 'net-zero carbon' standards with a goal of a major energy transition by 2035 [88]. Furthermore, researchers have identified the impact of climate change on decisions to migrate or stay [107], aiding a deeper understanding of social impacts such as climate refugee issues, and the WWF is advocating for governments to address the impacts of climate change [113], underscoring the importance of policy responses.

briefing.closing: Today's briefing has highlighted the severity of the climate crisis and the diverse domestic and international efforts being made to overcome it. This is a time that calls for sustained attention and action. This concludes the daily climate briefing for December 19, 2025.
